definition: desperately serious/disastrous/extremely/exceedingly
(negative prefix)/not/no
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
unofficial variant of 瞭[liao4]
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(of eyes) bright/clear-sighted/to understand clearly

sentences.english: Those children are always chasing about, making a terrible noise.
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子总是追来追去，吵得不得了。

sentences.english: She took on terribly when she heard the news.
sentences.chinese: 她听到那坏消息伤心的不得了。

sentences.english: When Michele offered to help with the funeral arrangements, Dave could not thank her enough.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔主动提出帮助安排丧事，戴维感激得不得了。

sentences.english: Churchill found that subalterns were two a penny in India and invited nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔发现，在印度中尉多得不得了，没人要。

sentences.english: The boy felt embarrassed when he found a hole in his pants .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩发现裤子尚有个破洞时，尴尬得不得了。

sentences.english: People who have money to burn have so much money that they can spend it on anything they want.
sentences.chinese: 形容钱多的不得了，都可以用来烧，给我一点点好辽。

sentences.english: She is always all of a sweat before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 她临考前总是急得不得了。

sentences.english: Whenever food is the topic, Daniel becomes a happy camper.
sentences.chinese: 这大牛，一说到吃的他就开心得不得了。

sentences.english: The old lady slopped over all children she saw.
sentences.chinese: 这位老太太见了孩子就喜欢得不得了。

sentences.english: These children are always chasing about, making a terrible noise.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子总是追来追去，嬉戏打闹，吵得不得了。

sentences.english: It bothers me to no end that they would take advantage of their users like this.
sentences.chinese: 一想到他们会这样利用用户，我就烦得不得了。

sentences.english: Hearing this, the king was very delighted.
sentences.chinese: 文王一听这么厉害，高兴的不得了。

sentences.english: He suffers terribly with (ie is pained by) his feet.
He is over the moon when he sees the result.
sentences.chinese: 看到成绩表的时候，他高兴得不得了。

sentences.english: The fishermen were delighted with their huge haul of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那群渔民捕到一大网鱼，开心得不得了。

sentences.english: Anni was all stressed out last week because of the finals.
sentences.chinese: 因为期末考试的原因，安妮上星期紧张得不得了。

definition: (particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
won't do/be out of the question/be no good/not work/not be capable
unreasonable/shocking/outrageous
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
Wow!/sound of child's crying/sound of vomiting
replaces 啊[a5] when following the vowel "u" or "ao"
simply/at all/practically
no wonder!/so that's why!
(coll.) if
needless to say/it goes without saying
muddled and completely collapsing (idiom); in an awful condition/complete shambles/a total mess
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
difficult to deal with/difficult to endure/ferocious/radical/serious/terrible/violent/tremendous/awesome
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
